page.title: 15Irvine Marymass Races
page.content: One highlight of our town's{Marymass {Festival}is the{horse racing}which takes place on Irvine Moor on Marymass Saturday each year.This is reputed to be the{oldest horse race meeting in {the World.}It dates back to{the 12th {century}when men from Irvine Carters Society raced their cart horses at the Marymass Fair to prove whose horse was the best. The winning owner got more business from merchants for having the fastest horses.The races are still held on the moor on the Saturday following the third Monday in August each year and they are organised by the{Irvine Carters' Society.}They are for heavy cart horses, ponies and donkeys and great crowds of people enjoy watching these races and all the activities of the fair which is held alongside.
